Question: Another 18th-century story has this person starting his theatrical career minding the horses of theatre patrons in London.
Hints: The Halls had one child, Elizabeth, who married twice but died without children in 1670, ending this person’s direct line.
Some of this person's plays were published in quarto editions from 1594.
In his will, this person left the bulk of his large estate to his elder daughter Susanna.
